alert.note: Alert for Parmer (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 11:26PM CDT until May 27 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of the Panhandle of Texas, including the following county, Parmer. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1125 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. The heaviest rainfall has moved off to the southeast of the area and only light rain remained. An estimated 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen with localized areas between 3 and 4 inches. Widespread street flooding has been reported in Friona and Bovina. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Friona, Bovina, Farwell, Oklahoma Lane, Rhea, Lariat and Black. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
